events.message: The customer reported a car collision that happened on the morning of May 1st, involving significant damage to the front bumper and hood.
The claim has been categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and photos of the damaged vehicle.
An agent has been assigned to handle the customer's auto accident claim to ensure appropriate follow-up and support.
The insurance company acknowledged the claim and informed the customer that the process is underway, emphasizing support.
The insurance agent requested accident reports, repair estimates, and photos of the vehicle damage for further investigation.
The customer submitted all requested documents, including the police accident report and mechanicâ€™s repair assessment.
The investigation team began reviewing the submitted documents and photos to determine liability and damage extent.
The investigation was completed confirming the customer's fault was minimal and damage estimates matched the reported figures.
A settlement offer was proposed covering full repair costs and rental car expenses while the vehicle is repaired.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the responsiveness and fairness of the settlement offered by the insurer.
The claim was officially approved, authorizing payment to the repair shop and coverage for the agreed terms.
Payment for the vehicle repairs was issued promptly to the authorized garage to begin the restoration process.
After confirming repairs completion and customer satisfaction, the claim was closed successfully without pending issues.
